alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Mathews; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Northampton, and southeastern Mathews Counties, the southeastern City of Poquoson and the City of Hampton through 315 PM EDT... At 208 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Bavon, or 8 miles west of Cape Charles, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hampton, Cape Charles, Nassawadox, Cheriton, Buckroe Beach, Bavon, Bay View, Grand View, Eastville, Capeville, Kiptopeke State Park, Franktown, Cheapside, Kiptopeke, Plantation, Birdsnest, Fox Hill, Phoebus, Peary and Machipongo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.
